thread.title: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: 3-point contest, Skills Challenge updates, results
thread.title_full: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: 3-point contest, Skills Challenge updates, results

author: Jordan Greer (jgreer@sportingnews.com)
title: NBA All-Star Weekend 2017: 3-point contest, Skills Challenge updates, results
text:
February 18, 2017 7:44pm   7:44pm EST Timberwolves star Karl-Anthony Towns isn't in New Orleans to defend his Skills Challenge crown, but Warriors sharpshooter Klay Thompson will try to make it back-to-back 3-point contest titles. Klay Thompson (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:44 p.m. ET 
Updated at 7:44 p.m. ET 
It's the All-Star moment NBA fans have been waiting for ... the Skills Challenge! 
OK, maybe people are more excited about Saturday night's Slam Dunk Contest. But plenty of notable stars will participate in the Skills Challenge and 3-point Contest, including Warriors sharpshooter and 2016 3-point champion Klay Thompson. 
MORE: 3-point contest, Skills Challenge participants, rules 
Timberwolves center Karl-Anthony Towns isn't in New Orleans to defend his Skills Challenge crown, but big men like DeMarcus Cousins, Anthony Davis, Nikola Jokic and Kristaps Porzingis will show off their abilities against a loaded field of guards. 
Sporting News will provide results and highlights for the Skills Challenge and 3-point Contest throughout the evening. Check back for the latest results below. NBA Skills Challenge participants, results 
Devin Booker, Suns
